thread.title: How Google Android app will help Delhiites get about

author: financialexpress.com
title: How Google Android app will help Delhiites get about
text:
Other Articles Adam Lambert has `no beef` with Demi Lovato, Nick Jonas How childhood trauma affects sexual well-being Vegetative patients show glimmers of awareness Google has introduced an Android app called Delhi Public Transport Offline that helps the users navigate using public transport in Delhi.
According to The Next Web, the app allows the users to get around using bus and metro routes and supports DMRC Metro, DTC buses, Gurgaon Rapid Metro and DIMTS Orange buses.
The users can also view bus and metro timetables and receive notifications about Delhi transit news and metro delays.
Google says that Delhi Public Transport Offline is an experimental app and designed to make it easier for Delhi residents to get around on public transit.
The app is can be downloaded for free from the Google Play Store.
 09, 2015 3:35 pm
